What a great gem of a house: late 20s/30s bungalow felt just like grandma's house. Great design & updated everything, but with antique/vintage touches too (old turntable & records to play was a nice touch). Fantastic bedding/linens, tons of amenities, stocked kitchen. Everything was impeccably clean, too. The recommendations for local eateries & such were well done. The only drawbacks were neighborhood, noise & cooling. The house is in a pretty empty neighborhood---sketchy? I don't know the area, so hard to say, but not a place we felt comfortable walking around at night. The location is just a block off the major east/west highway which parallels major train tracks, so you will need ear plugs for the noise (constant throughout the night---but they were provided). Also, there is an AC in the living room, but not in the bedrooms: if you need it cool to sleep you will not be happy. Overall, though, we loved this house & would certainly stay again on our next drive through El Paso.
